description:
Overview

Medxcel is here to lead the transformation of healthcare facilities management by incorporating a new approach to providing services. Created by healthcare, for healthcare, we have a dedicated focus on our people and customers, as well as providing tools, processes, support resources, data analytics and insource strategies that drive results.

The Sales Director II will be responsible for creating, implementing and executing a national C-Suite sales strategy, lead initiatives, maintain and expand relationships with strategically important partners and customers that meet the defined target account criteria. This position will be responsible for identifying strategic opportunities to utilize Medxcel executives and Operations team members to facilitate and provide momentum to the individual account sales process. Additionally, the position will be responsible for ongoing management of the customer relationship in collaboration with Executive Leadership, Marketing, BDS, Operations and the other functional department leaders through the close process. This position will require significant travel, between 40-60%.

The Sales Director II will represent the entire range of Medxcel products and services to assigned target accounts and customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring that the customer’s needs and expectations are met during the CSA and/or pricing process and the account closing process.

This position will be located at Home Office- Remote.

Responsibilities

Account Development (75%)
• Responsible for creating, implementing and executing a national C-Suite sales strategy.
• Develop target accounts, territory management and ownership of the sales process from survey to contract signature.
• Works with Sales Leadership and Marketing to identify and maintain an accurate target account list within defined territory.
• Participates in a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for defined periods.
• Establishes productive, professional relationships with key contacts in defined target accounts.
• Completes an operational and strategic assessment of the target account. Leads solution development efforts that best address customer needs, while coordinating the involvement of all necessary company personnel
• Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including Medxcel Leadership, Marketing, Business Development, Operations and Legal in order to meet customers’ expectations and complete the contract sale.
• Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs throughout the sales process.
• Enlists the support of Business Development, Marketing/Customer Engagement, Implementation and Operations to ensure an effective initiation and ongoing customer relationship.
• Meets annual goals for account/relationship development and delivery of sales presentations to target account executives.
• Meets annual sales revenue targets
CRM Documentation (15%)
• Document all activity with target accounts and contacts in CRM
• Assure all account and contact documentation is completed in CRM
• Provide updates for sales review meetings and Sales Pipeline Report

Training and Development (10%)
• Participate in formal and informal sales training activities and sales meetings
• Attend periodic Operations meetings, Operations webinars and calls, etc. to maintain a strategic connection to regional operations and innovations in Medxcel sites and a connection to key customer leadership for recommendations and references
• Maintain a connection with the Medxcel Corporate Office to establish and maintain key relationships with Marketing, Business Development, Implementation, Operations, Legal, Regulatory, HR, Finance and Medxcel leadership.

Qualifications

Education:
• Bachelor’s degree in business, sales, marketing, healthcare administration, or a related field required

Experience:
• 10 years of executive level business and/or strategic selling experience required
• Strong leadership skills required
• Ability to take risk and the willingness to lead into new, unfamiliar markets required
• Experience in project management required
• Knowledge of the healthcare industry required
• Ability to manage a budget required
• Ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projects required
• Ability to collaborate with cross-functional and organizational teams and obtain buy-in required
• Business Acumen and the knowledge to understand operations required
• Strong written, verbal, and presentational skills required
• Strong customer focus required

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Knowledge of strategic selling practices in the healthcare market
• Strong customer relationship skills; including strong written, verbal and presentational communication skills
• Ability to establish credibility with all levels of personnel including healthcare executives and hospital and health system leadership
